00020 #include <stdlib.h>
00021 #include <iostream>
00022 #include <map>
00023 #include <set>
00024 #include <vector>
00025 #include <algorithm>
00026 #include <utility>
00027 #include <string>
00028 #include <fstream>
00029 #include <sstream>
00030 
00031 using namespace std;
00032 
00033 // This is a v.simple logging component.
00034 // Call tableout.set("PropertyName", 127)
00035 
00036 class TableOut
00037 {
00038     private:
00039     // All the data for this run is kept in the map    
00040     map<string, string> data;
00041     string filename;
00042     
00043     // Don't allow copying!
00044     TableOut(const TableOut& t); 
00045     public:
00046     TableOut() {}
00047       
00048     template <class Valtype>
00049     void set(string propname, Valtype value)
00050     {
00051         // create a new, or overwrite the, entry with name propname
00052         data[propname] = to_string(value);
00053     }
00054     
00055     void debug_printall()
00056     {
00057         std::map<string, string>::iterator it;
00058         
00059         for(it = data.begin(); it != data.end(); it++)
00060         {
00061             cout<< (*it).first << "," << (*it).second << endl;
00062         }
00063     }
00064     
00065     void print_line()
00066     {
00067         // First version: this checks if we are at the top of a file. If so, prints column headers. 
00068         // Then
00069         // outputs a line. 
00070         
00071         // If the column headers are unexpected, should print something to cerr.
00072         
00073         // Second version should be able to cope with different column headers? At least different orders?
00074         
00075         fstream f(filename.c_str(), ios::app | ios::out);  // Open with append mode.
00076         
00077         if(!f)
00078         {
00079             cerr << "tableout.cpp: failed to open file to output table." << endl;
00080         }
00081         
00082         // if file position is the beginning of the file, then output the column headers.
00083         if(f.tellp()==streampos(0))
00084         {
00085             f << "#";
00086             
00087             map<string, string>::iterator it;
00088             for(it = data.begin(); it != data.end(); it++)
00089             {
00090                 f<<  "\"" << (*it).first << "\" " ;
00091             }
00092             f <<endl;
00093         }
00094         
00095         // This doesn't work with strings that have spaces in them. 
00096         
00097         map<string, string>::iterator it;
00098         for(it = data.begin(); it != data.end(); it++)
00099         {
00100             f << (*it).second << " " ;
00101         }
00102         f << endl;
00103         
00104         f.close();
00105     }
00106     
00107     void set_filename(string file)
00108     {
00109         filename=file;
00110     }
00111 };
00112 
00113 // Provide a global singleton of the above class. Not threadsafe!
00114 inline TableOut& getTableOut()
00115 {
00116   static TableOut t;
00117   return t;
00118 }
